result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley M Belcourt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or serve 6 days jail as penalty for non payment of fine.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ashley M Belcourt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Proof of treatment.

Attorney Carl William Chesshir in court.   Defendant Ashley M Belcourt did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  No contest plea entered.  Court orders the following:
$299.00 to be paid within 60 days or 6 days jail for penalty for non payment of fine.
Jury status hearing on May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshir advises the Court that the Defendant has completed treatment but needs additional time to obtain the completion certificate.   The Court to recall the case this afternoon.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.

Jury status hearing on May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case was set for plea and sentencing today but Atty. Chesshir requests a new date for completion of treatment.  Court sets for trial.
  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-17-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Chesshir advises the Court the Defendant is currently involved in treatment and is expected to finish in approximately 30 days.   There is an offer to amend with completion of treatment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Hearing at 02-19-2016 09:00 am

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   The State has an offer to amend with completion of treatment. The Defendant is currently enrolled in classes but doesn't begin classed until December 26, 2016.   Hearing scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Hearing at 10-21-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received a new offer and defendant needs to complete anger management.   State has offer to amend charge. Defense requests a review date in 30 days. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense made a counter offer to the district attorney's office that was rejected. Defendant's citizenship addressed. Defense requests another date. Court grants request.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court with attorney Carl William Chesshir.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense has received an offer and needs to discuss this with his client. Defense requests another date in 3 weeks. Defense to advise on the next date how he will proceed - trial or plea.  Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on August 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Attorney appears by authorization

Attorney Carl William Chesshir in court.   Defendant Ashley M Belcourt did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State provided discovery and pretrial offer to Atty. Chesshir. Defense requests another date to discuss this matter with his client. Defense to advise court how they will proceed on the next date.  Hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any officer or the victim/witness listed in the complaint.   Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.

Defendant Ashley M Belcourt in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
